# id: ExecScriptTest -> @Test     @DirtiesContext     @Ignore     public void testExecuteScript() throws Exception
commentText:
TODO the test is ignored for now to prevent accidental build_failures. Java 1.5 does not offer a method to check if a file is_executable there is only a canRead method, which is not enough to_guarantee that the script can be executed.
__@throws Exception
codeText: @Test_    @DirtiesContext_    @Ignore_    public void testExecuteScript() throws Exception {_        File scriptFile = getExecScriptFileOrNull("exec-test-script")__        if (scriptFile != null) {_            String classpathArg = getClasspathArg()__            Exchange exchange = executeScript(scriptFile, NO_TIMEOUT, classpathArg, PRINT_IN_STDOUT)__            if (exchange != null) {_                String out = (String)exchange.getIn().getHeader(EXEC_STDOUT)__                String err = (String)exchange.getIn().getHeader(EXEC_STDERR)___                assertNotNull(out)__                assertTrue(out.contains(PRINT_IN_STDOUT))__                assertNull(err)__            }_        } else {_            String os = System.getProperty("os.name")__            logger.warn("Executing batch scripts is not tested on " + os)__        }_    }
